com.CMPUT301W20T24.OnMyWay

Class UserRequestState

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.CMPUT301W20T24.OnMyWay.UserRequestState

  • public class UserRequestState
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores objects needed for the global state of the application (objects shared between multiple activities, classes in the app simultaneously like current user, current request, etc.). Has methods for updating values in the UserRequestState. Later this will be modified to either fetch data from the database or offline, depending on whether the user has an internet connection or not

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentUser

        public static User getCurrentUser()
        Returns the currently logged in user. This will be null if the user isn't logged in yet
        Returns:
        A User object of the currently logged in User

      • setCurrentUser

        public static void setCurrentUser(User newUser)
        Sets the current user only if one doesn't exist already
        Parameters:
        newUser - The User object we want to change currentUser to

      • updateCurrentUser

        public static void updateCurrentUser()
        Calls DBManager to push user info to FireStore. To modify currentUser, use getCurrentUser() first to get and modify the current User, then call this method to push the changes to the database

      • isLoggedIn

        public static boolean isLoggedIn()
        Checks if there is a user logged in or not
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating whether the user is logged in or not

      • logoutUser

        public static void logoutUser()
        Logs out the current user. First removes the current user from UserRequestState and then calls DBManager to log out the user from Firebase Auth

        public static Request getCurrentRequest()

      • setCurrentRequest

        public static void setCurrentRequest(Request newRequest)

        public static void updateCurrentRequest()

        public static void cancelCurrentRequest()
